meanings.sent1: The decision was moot, so we had to discuss it further.
meanings.sent2: The moot point led to a long conversation among friends.
meanings.sent3: The moot topic made everyone share their opinions.
meanings.sent4: Her moot idea sparked a lively debate in the classroom.
meanings.sent5: The moot issue lingered in their minds long after the meeting.

meanings.sent1: The validity of his argument was moot after new evidence emerged.
meanings.sent2: The outcome of the game was moot due to the controversial call.
meanings.sent3: It was moot whether to go left or right on the confusing trail.
meanings.sent4: The future of the project remained moot until further research was done.
meanings.sent5: The moot decision left everyone uncertain about the next steps.

meanings.sent1: She mooted the idea of a team outing to the beach.
meanings.sent2: He mooted the possibility of changing the meeting time.
meanings.sent3: They mooted the plan to have a picnic in the park.
meanings.sent4: Mooting the proposal at the meeting led to a fruitful conversation.
meanings.sent5: The teacher mooted the idea of a class project to the students.

meanings.sent1: The success of the project seemed moot given the current circumstances.
meanings.sent2: His promises appeared moot as time went on.
meanings.sent3: It was moot whether the event would be a success without proper planning.
meanings.sent4: The future of the company looked moot without significant changes.
meanings.sent5: The moot outcome left everyone wondering about the next steps.

meanings.definition: To raise as a topic for discussion
meanings.sent1: He mooted the idea of organizing a charity event.
meanings.sent2: She mooted the suggestion of implementing a new policy.
meanings.sent3: They mooted the proposal to renovate the community center.
meanings.sent4: Mooting the question at the meeting sparked a productive conversation.
meanings.sent5: The team leader mooted the concept of team-building activities.
